TEMPLATE.FORMAT: C_Com(<communication line number>) = "ETH:<server side IP address>"
C_Com(<communication line number>) = "ETH:<server side IP address>, <port number>"
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Sets the parameters for the line to be opened by the Open instruction.
This is used when the communication destination is changed frequently.
This variable returns the current date in the format of year/month/date.
For instance, C1$ becomes "2007/04/01".
This variable returns information on the manufacturer of the robot controller.
This variable returns the name of the mechanism that is acquiring the control right.

This variable returns the selected program number (name).
This variable returns the current time in the format of time:minute:second (24 hours notation).
For instance, C1$ becomes "13/01/30".
This variable returns the data registered in the "USERMSG" parameter.
Returns the joint type data at the current position.
Return the maximum value of the differences between the estimated torque and actual torque while the impact detection function is being enabled.
Returns the current encoder pulse value.(Unit: pulse)

Returns the ratio of current deceleration time. (%)

Refer to whether the force control is effective or invalid.
Refer whether to exceed the force setting value now.

Refer to the value of the parameter used by the inspection algorithm.
Refer to the execution result of the force inspection function.
Returns the resultant force of force sensor.
Returns the resultant moment of force sensor.

Returns the initial deceleration time value. (100%)
Returns the current acceleration/deceleration status.
(Current status: 0 = Stopped, 1 = Accelerating, 2 = Constant speed, 3 = Decelerating)
Returns the result of executing a line containing a Break command that was executed last.
(Return value: 1:Break was executed, 0:Break was not executed)
Return the present base coordinate number
Returns the remaining hour of battery left. (Unit: hour)

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Act 1, M_CavSts(<Mechanism Number>) > 0 GoTo *LCAV, S
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Return the collision avoidance status.
Returns the amount of difference (in mm) between the command value and the actual value from the robot when executing the compliance function.
Returns whether or not the command value when the compliance function is being executed is about to exceed various limits.
Return the impact detection status.
Returns the status of whether or not a program is on cycle stop.
Returns the status of whether or not a program is on cycle operation.
References the input register of CC-Link (optional).

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Numeric Variable(Long precision integer)> = M_DIn32(<Input register number>)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: References the input register of CC-Link (option) to 32bit data.
Write or reference the output register of CC-Link (optional).

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Numeric Variable((Long precision integer)) > = M_DOut32(<Output register number>)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: References the output register of CC-Link (option) to 32bit data.
Write 32bit data in the output register of CC-Link (option).
Write or reference the external encoder value of the specified encoder number.
References or sets the point data of Electric Hand 1.
References or sets the point data of Electric Hand 2.
References or sets the point data of Electric Hand 3.
Returns the current position of Electric Hand.
Returns the state of operation of Electric Hand.
Returns the state of target position attainment of Electric Hand.
Returns the state of holding of Electric Hand.
Returns the state of stop in specified area of Electric Hand.
Returns the state of original position return of Electric Hand.
Returns the movement completion point number of Electric Hand.
References the operate mode in table data of Electric Hand 1.
References the operate mode in table data of Electric Hand 2.
References the operate mode in table data of Electric Hand 3.
Write or reference the external encoder value when the TREN signal of the specified encoder number.
Returns the external encoder maximum value of the specified encoder number.
Returns the external encoder minimum value of the specified encoder number.
Returns the external encoder speed of the specified encoder number.
Returns whether an error has been generated.
(1: Error has been generated, 0: No error)
Returns the level of the generated error.
(Caution/Low/High1/High2 = 1/2/3/4)
Returns the transit speed of the Ex-T coordinate during the Ex-T control and the Ex-T spline interpolation.
Returns the base of natural logarithm (2.718281828459045).
Returns the difference between the command position and the feedback position.
Returns gravitational constant (9.80665).
The hand opening and shutting can be directed with WthIf.
Returns the hand check input signal(1 - 8) value.

The value of the input signal is returned by byte unit (8 bits) expression.
The value of the input signal is returned by word unit (16 bits) expression.

The value of the input signal is returned by word unit (16 bits) expression.
The value of the input signal is returned by double word unit (32 bits) expression.
Returns value specified by the override JOvrd instruction for joint interpolation.
Returns initial override value (100%) for joint interpolation.
Returns override value of the operation panel.
Returns current override value, value specified by the Ovrd instruction.
Returns initial override value (100%).
The load ratio for each joint axis can be referenced.
The maximum load factor of the specified axis can be referred.
Returns the line number that is being executed.
Returns the key switch mode of the operation panel.
Indicates the number of pieces of work detected by the vision sensor.
Indicates the vision sensor line connection status.
0: Line connecting (logon not complete)
1: Logon complete
-1: Not connected

Stores the data recognized by the vision sensor in numeric data format.

Always returns 1 (M_On).
Always returns 0 (M_Off).
RetReturns the status indicating whether or not a file is opened.
Writes or references external output signal.
M_Out : Output signal bit.
Writes or references external output signal.
M_Outb : Output signal byte (8 bits).
Writes or references external output signal.
M_Outw : Output signal word (16 bits).
Writes or references external output signal.
M_Out8 : Output signal byte (8 bits).
Writes or references external output signal.
M_Out16 : Output signal word (16 bits).
Writes or references external output signal.

The number of the station currently in operation
The station number which saved in the flash ROM
Returns whether the program is selectable by the specified task slot.
Returns how much the robot has approached the target position (0 to 100%) while the robot is moving.
Robot controller's various information is read.
Returns the remaining distance to the target position (in mm) while the robot is moving.
Returns whether the program for the specified task slot is being executed.
Set the acceleration/deceleration time distribution rate of the specified axis when optimum acceleration/deceleration control is enabled (Oadl On).
Returns the monitor mode status of the functional safety.
Return the calculation result of the load factor simulation. (unit: %)
Beginning/end of the load factor simulation is specified.
Returns the result of executing the line containing the last executed Skip command.
Returns the currently set speed during XYZ and JOINT interpolation.
Returns the initial value at the speed during XYZ and JOINT interpolation.
Returns the directive speed information during XYZ and JOINT interpolation.
Returns the number of the newest passing path point of the spline interpolation.
Returns the latest numerical value set to the path point of the spline file.
The value of this state variable is changed to the specified integral value.
Returns the current status of the servo power supply.
Time is measured in milliseconds.
In addition to using the tool data (MEXTL1 to 4) of the specified number as the current tool data, it is also set in the MEXTL parameter.
Return the number of data stored in the specified tracking buffer.
Return the tracking operation of the specified mechanism.
1: Tracking
0: Not tracking
This state variable specifies the tracking buffer number that reads out data.
This state variable specifies coordinates on the starting side of a tracking possible area.
This state variable specifies coordinates on the ending side of a tracking possible area.
This state variable specifies coordinates in which the tracking is canceled.
This state variable specifies the time that can be waited until workpiece enters a tracking possible area.
The execution result of the TrkChk command can be referred to.
0: There is no workpiece in the tracking buffer.
1: The workpiece has passed from the tracking area.
2: The workpiece after a while enters the tracking area.
3: The workpiece is in tracking area.
The workpiece encoder taken out of the tracking buffer can be referred to.
The kind number taken out of the tracking buffer can be referred to.
The encoder number taken out of the tracking buffer can be referred to.
This state variable specifies encoder data at the position in which the sensor reacts to workpiece.
This state variable specifies encoder data at tracking area starting position.
This state variable specifies encoder data at tracking area ending position.
This state variable specifies encoder data at tracking cancellation position.
Return the encoder value which accumulated after a sensor reacts to a workpiece.
Return the type of the tracking function.
Returns whether the robot is in the user-defined area.
Returns whether the robot is in the user-defined area.
Bits 0 through 31 correspond to areas 1 to 8 and each bit displays the following information.
1 : Within user-defined area
0 : Outside user-defined area

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Numeric Variable> = M_UDevW(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)
M_UDevW(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)=<Numeric Value>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Writes the data(unit of word) in the shared memory.
Refers from the shared memory to the data(unit of word).

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Numeric Variable> = M_UDevD(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)
M_UDevD(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)=<Numeric Value>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Writes the data(unit of double word) in the shared memory.
Refers from the shared memory to the data(unit of double word).

Stores the data recognized by MELFA-3D Vision in numeric data format.
Stores reply value from MELFA-3D Vision in numeric data format.
Stores the number of pieces of work detected by MELFA-3D Vision.
Stores the recognition result of writing of MELFA-3D Vision in numeric data format.
Returns the standby status of the program for the specified task slot.
Returns the value of an override (warm-up operation override, unit: %) to be applied to the command speed in order to reduce the operation speed when in the warm-up operation status.
Returns the time (sec) during which a target axis must operate to cancel the warm-up operation status.
Returns the time (sec) until the warm-up operation status is set again after it has been canceled.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Position Variable> = P_UDev(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)
P_UDev(<Start I/O number>, <Shared memory address>)=<Position Value>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Writes the position data in the shared memory.
Refers from the shared memory to the position data.
the positional data that MELFA-3D Vision recognized by a positional format.
Return or set the work coordinate data (WK1CORD-WK8CORD).
Returns the state of preliminary stopping near Position monitoring plane.
Returns the absolute value of a given value.
Return the reverse-cosine value of the specified < Equation >.
Returns the character code of the first character in the string.
Return the reverse-sine value of the specified < Equation >.
Calculates the arc tangent.
Calculates the arc tangent.
Value is converted to a binary string.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Numeric Variable 4> = CalArc(<Position 1>, <Position 2>, <Position 3>, <Numeric Variable 1>, <Numeric Variable 2>, <Numeric Variable 3>, <Position Variables 1>)
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: M1=CalArc(P1, P2, P3, M10, M20, M30, P10)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Provides information regarding the arc that contains the three specified points.
Returns the character that has the character code obtained from the specified equation.
Rounds the fractional part of an equation to convert the value into an integer.
Calculates the checksum of the string.
Gives the cosine.
Converts the character codes of the first two characters of a string into an integer.
M1 becomes "&H3031" for the sample.
Converts the character codes of the first four characters of a string into a single precision real number.
M1 becomes "12689.6" for the sample.
Converts the character codes of the first eight characters of a string into a double precision real number.
M1 becomes "3.52954+ E+30" for the sample.
Converts the unit of angle measurement from radians (rad) into degrees (deg).
Calculates the distance between two points (position variables).
Return the dot product result in specified < position 1> and < position 2>.
Calculates exponential functions. (an equation that uses "e" as the base.)
Returns the integral portion of the equation.
Calculates the position data that indicates a coordinate system (plane) specified by three position data.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Character String Variable > = Hex$(<Equation>, <Number of output characters>)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Converts the value of an equation (Between -32768 to 32767) into hexadecimal string.
Returns the largest integer that does not exceed the value of the equation.
Obtains the position data of the inverse matrix of the position variable.
Given joint data will be converted into position data.
Obtains a string of the specified length starting from the left end.
Returns the length of the string.
Returns the natural logarithm. (Base e.)
Returns the common logarithm. (Base 10.)
Obtains the maximum value.
Returns a string of the specified length starting from the specified position of the string.
Obtains the minimum value.
Inverts the bit string representing each character code of the string in binary,
and obtains the character-coded string. C1$ becomes "RB" for the sample.
Converts the value of an equation (integer) into a two-byte string.
Converts the value of an equation (single-precision real number) into a four-byte string.
Converts the value of an equation (double-precision real number) into a eight-byte string.
Checks whether the given position is within the movement range.
Obtain the middle position data when a linear interpolation is performed between two given points.
Converts the given position data into a joint data.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Position Variables> = PVSCal(<Calibration No.>,<V/S X>,<V/S Y>,<V/S Theta>])
<Position Variables> = PVSCal(<Calibration No.>,<V/S X>,<V/S Y>,<V/S Theta>,<Reference position variable>)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Given vision sensor's image coordinate data will be converted into robot's world coordinate position data.
Converts the unit of angle measurement from degrees (deg) into radians (rad).
Returns the structure flag of the specified position using character data "R"/"L", "A"/"B", and "N"/"F".
Returns the multiple rotation information of the specified joint axis.
Generates a random number.
Obtains a string of the specified length starting from the right end.
Changes the structure flag of the specified position using a string (such as "RAN").
Changes the multiple rotation data of the specified position.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <<Joint Variable>> = SetJnt(<J1 Axis>, <J2 Axis>, <J3 Axis>, <J4 Axis>)
<<Joint Variable>> = SetJnt(<J1 Axis>, <J2 Axis>, <J3 Axis>, <J4 Axis>), <J5 Axis>))
<<Joint Variable>> = SetJnt(<J1 Axis>, <J2 Axis>, <J3 Axis>, <J4 Axis>), <J5 Axis>), <J6 Axis>))
<<Joint Variable>> = SetJnt(<J1 Axis>, <J2 Axis>, <J3 Axis>, <J4 Axis>), <J5 Axis>), <J6 Axis>), <J7 Axis>))
<<Joint Variable>> = SetJnt(<J1 Axis>, <J2 Axis>, <J3 Axis>, <J4 Axis>), <J5 Axis>), <J6 Axis>), <J7 Axis>), <J8 Axis>))
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Sets the value to the joint variable.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <<Position Variable>> = SetPos(<X Axis>, <Y Axis>, <Z Axis>, <A Axis>)
<<Position Variable>> = SetPos(<X Axis>, <Y Axis>, <Z Axis>, <A Axis>, <B Axis>)
<<Position Variable>> = SetPos(<X Axis>, <Y Axis>, <Z Axis>, <A Axis>, <B Axis>, <C Axis>)
<<Position Variable>> = SetPos(<X Axis>, <Y Axis>, <Z Axis>, <A Axis>, <B Axis>, <C Axis>, <L1 Axis>)
<<Position Variable>> = SetPos(<X Axis>, <Y Axis>, <Z Axis>, <A Axis>, <B Axis>, <C Axis>, <L1 Axis>, <L2 Axis>)
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: P2=SetPos(P1.X, P1.Y, P1.Z, M10, M20, M30)
P2=SetPos(P1.X, P1.Y, P1.Z, M10, M20, M30, 1)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Sets the value to the Position variable.
Checks the sign of the equation.
Calculates the sine.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: <Pos Variable> = SplPos(<Spline Number>, <Path Point Number>, <Frame Conversion>)
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Acquires the path point corresponding to the path point number that is registered in the spline file specified by the spline number.
Calculate the maximum speed that can be specified by the spline command based on information registered in the spline file specified by the spline number.
Acquires the Ex-T Coordinate data that is registered in the spline file specified by the spline number.
Calculates the square root of an equation value.
Convert a string to lower case.
Convert a string to upper case.
Searches for a specified string in a string.
Converts the value of the equation into a decimal string.
Calculates the tangent.
Acquire the coordinate position of a workpiece being tracked.
Obtain the current position of a workpiece.
Converts the value in the string into a numerical value.
Checks if the specified position is within the specified area (a rectangular solid defined by two points).
Checks if the specified position is within the specified area (Cylindrical area defined by two points).
Checks if the specified position is within the specified area (The cube which consists of the three points).

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Accel <Accel rate>, <Decel rate>, <Accel rate when moving up>
Accel <Accel rate>, <Decel rate>, <Accel rate when moving up>, <Decel rate when moving up>
Accel <Accel rate>, <Decel rate>, <Accel rate when moving up>, <Decel rate when moving up>, <Accel rate when moving down>
Accel <Accel rate>, <Decel rate>, <Accel rate when moving up>, <Decel rate when moving up>, <Accel rate when moving down>, <Decel rate when moving down>
Accel <Accel rate>, <Decel rate>, , , <Accel rate when moving down>, <Decel rate when moving down>
Accel , , <Accel rate when moving up>, <Decel rate when moving up>
Accel , , <Accel rate when moving up>, <Decel rate when moving up>, <Accel rate when moving down>, <Decel rate when moving down>
Accel , , , , <Accel rate when moving down>, <Decel rate when moving down>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Designate the robot's acceleration and deceleration speeds as a percentage (%).
This instruction specifies whether to allow or prohibit interrupt processing caused by signals, etc.
With this instruction, it is possible to move or rotate the robot coordinate system. Specify the base conversion data or the base coordinate number for this instruction.
Locking the robot's brake.
This instruction executes the specified program (by calling the program in a manner similar to using GoSub to call a subroutine)
Set to enable/disable the collision avoidance function in automatic operation.
Set to enable/disable the collision avoidance function in automatic operation.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: ChrSrch <Character string array variable>, <Character string>, <Search result storage destination>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Searches the character string out of the character array.
Closes the designated file.(including communication lines)
This instruction clears general-purpose output signals, local numerical variables in a program, and numerical external variables.
Start the soft control mode (compliance mode) of the specified axis in the JOINT coordinates system.
Start the soft control mode (compliance mode) of the specified axis in the XYZ coordinates system.
Start the soft control mode (compliance mode) of the specified axis in the TOOL coordinates system.
Release the soft control mode (compliance mode).

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: CmpG <X axis gain>, <Y axis gain>, <Z axis gain>, , , , ,
CmpG <X axis gain>, <Y axis gain>, <Z axis gain>, <A axis gain>, , , ,
CmpG <X axis gain>, <Y axis gain>, <Z axis gain>, <A axis gain>, <B axis gain>, , ,
CmpG <X axis gain>, <Y axis gain>, <Z axis gain>, <A axis gain>, <B axis gain>, <C axis gain>, ,
CmpG <J1 axis gain>, <J2 axis gain>, <J3 axis gain>, , , , ,
CmpG <J1 axis gain>, <J2 axis gain>, <J3 axis gain>, <J4 axis gain>, , , ,
CmpG <J1 axis gain>, <J2 axis gain>, <J3 axis gain>, <J4 axis gain>, <J5 axis gain>, , ,
CmpG <J1 axis gain>, <J2 axis gain>, <J3 axis gain>, <J4 axis gain>, <J5 axis gain>, <J6 axis gain>, ,
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Specify the softness of robot control.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Cnt <Continuous movement mode/acceleration/deceleration movement mode>, <Numeric value 1>
Cnt <Continuous movement mode/acceleration/deceleration movement mode>, <Numeric value 1>, <Numeric value 2>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Designates continuous movement control for interpolation. Shortening of the operating time can be performed by carrying out continuous movement.
Set to enable/disable the impact detection function in automatic operation.
Set to enable/disable the impact detection function in automatic operation.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: ColLvl <J1 axis>, <J2 axis>, <J3 axis>, <J4 axis>, <J5 axis>, , ,
ColLvl <J1 axis>, <J2 axis>, <J3 axis>, <J4 axis>, <J5 axis>, <J6 axis>, ,
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Set the detection level of the impact detection function in automatic operation.
Allows interrupts from a communication line.
Prevents interrupts from a communication line.
Prohibits interrupts from a communication line.

This instruction defines the interrupt conditions for monitoring signals concurrently and performing interrupt processing during program execution, as well as the processing that will take place when an interrupt occurs.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>
Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>, <Upward evasion increment>
Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>, <Upward evasion increment>, <downward evasion increment>
Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>, <Upward evasion increment>, <downward evasion increment>, <interpolation type>
Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>, <Upward evasion increment>, <downward evasion increment>, <interpolation type>, <interpolation type1>

Def Arch <Arch number>, <upward movement increment>, <downward movement increment>, <Upward evasion increment>, <downward evasion increment>, <interpolation type>, <interpolation type1>, <interpolation type2>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: This instruction defines an arch shape for the arch motion movement corresponding to the Mva instruction.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Char <Character string variable name>, <Character string variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Declares a character string variable.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def FN <Identification character><Name>(<Dummy Argument>) = <Function Definition Expression>
Def FN <Identification character><Name>(<Dummy Argument>, <Dummy Argument>...) = <Function Definition Expression>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Defines a function and gives it name.
Defines the watch condition of the GPS function.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Inte <Numeric value variable name>, <Numeric value variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Use this instruction to declare numerical values.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Float <Numeric value variable name>, <Numeric value variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Use this instruction to declare numerical values.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Double <Numeric value variable name>, <Numeric value variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Use this instruction to declare numerical values.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def IO <Input/output variable name> = <Type designation>, <Input/output bit No.>
Def IO <Input/output variable name> = <Type designation>, <Input/output bit No.>, <Mask information>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Declares an input/output variable.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Jnt <Joint variable name>, <Joint variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: This instruction declares joint type position variables.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Long <Numeric value variable name>, <Numeric value variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Use this instruction to declare numerical values.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Map <Watch number>, <Input number>, <Condition> [, <Mechanism number>], <Lower position>, <Upper position>, <Steps>, <Sensitivity>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Defines the watch condition of the GPS function(Mapping function).
Use this instruction to declare Mo-Trigger.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Plt <Pallet No.>, <Start Point>, <End Point A>, <End Point B>, <Quantity A>, <Quantity B>, <Pallet Pattern>
Def Plt <Pallet No.>, <Start Point>, <End Point A>, <End Point B>, <Diagonal Point>, <Quantity A>, <Quantity B>, <Pallet Pattern>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: Def Plt 1, P1, P2, P3, P4, 3, 4, 1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Defines the pallet. (3-point pallet, 4-point pallet)

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Def Pos <Position variable name>, <Position variable name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: This instruction declares XYZ type position variables.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Dim <Variable name>(<Eelement Value>), <Variable name>(<Eelement Value>, <Eelement Value>)...
Dim <Variable name>(<Eelement Value>), <Variable name>(<Eelement Value>, <Eelement Value>, <Eelement Value>)...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Declares the quantity of elements in the array variable.
At a designated time, it causes a wait. / Designates an output time for a pulse.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EBRead #<Vision sensor number>, <Tag name>, <Variable name>, <Variable name>...
EBRead #<Vision sensor number>, <Tag name>, <Variable name>, <Variable name>... , <Timeout>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The data specified by the tag name of the vision sensor is received.
The data received from the vision sensor is stored in the specified variable.
The tag name of the vision sensor is specified, and data is written.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EHOpen <Hand No.>, <Speed>, <Force>, <Zone ON position>, <Zone OFF position>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Commands the Electric Hand to open.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EHClose <Hand No.>, <Speed>, <Force>, <Zone ON position>, <Zone OFF position>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Commands the Electric Hand to close.
Commands the Electric Hand to move to the specified position.
Commands the Electric Hand to do positioning and holding.
Commands the Electric Hand to return to the original position.
Commands the Electric Hand to stop.
Commands the Electric Hand to do condition of specified table number.
This instruction defines the final line of a program.
This instruction makes a program generate an error.
This instruction specifies completion conditions of the robot's positioning. It is invalid during the smooth movement control (CNT 1).
Repeatedly executes the program between the For statement and Next statement until the end conditions are satisfied.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Fsc On, <Condition A>, <Condition B>, <Designation of the offset cancellation>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Effective/invalidity of the force control function to use the force sensor is specified.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Fsc On, <Condition A>, <Condition B>, <Designation of the offset cancellation>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Effective/invalidity of the force control function to use the force sensor is specified.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: FsCTrg <Mo-Trigger number>, <Time required to switch>, <control characteristic number after switching>
FsCTrg <Mo-Trigger number>, <Time required to switch>, <control characteristic number after switching>, <timeout>, <execution type>
FsCTrg <Mo-Trigger number>, <Time required to switch>, <control characteristic number after switching>, <timeout>, <execution type>, <error>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The control characteristic switching of the force control with Mo-Trigger is set.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: FsGChg <Starting position of switching gain>, <Time required to switch>, <Condition B after switching gain>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The force control gain is changed while the interpolation is operating.
Beginning/end of logging of the force control is specified.
Beginning/end of logging of the force control is specified.
The log file made by FsLog command is read by the FTP.
The algorithm and the object axis of the inspection used by the force inspection function is specified.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: FsTBat <Log File Number>, <Coordinates Axis>, <Start Log Position>, <End Log Position>
FsTBat <Log File Number>, <Coordinates Axis>, <Start Log Position>, <End Log Position>, <Last Log Position>, <Tolerance>
FsTBat <Log File Number>, <Coordinates Axis>, <Start Log Position>, <End Log Position>, <Last Log Position>, <Tolerance>, <Force Threshold>, <Direction>, <Condition>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The force inspection function is executed by the batch processing by using the log data gathered by FsTest instruction.
The data cycle and the behavior of the force inspection function are set.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: FsTestOn, <Interpolation progress rate>, <Force Threshold>, <Force Direction>, <Approval Condition>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Beginning/end of the force inspection function is specified.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: FsTestOn, <Interpolation progress rate>, <Force Threshold>, <Force Direction>, <Approval Condition>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Beginning/end of the force inspection function is specified.
Beginning/end of the hand load estimation for force sensor is specified.
Beginning/end of the hand load estimation for force sensor is specified.
Obtains the data of the force sensor calibration.
Repeatedly executes the program between the For statement and Next statement until the end conditions are satisfied.
Repeatedly executes the program between the For statement and Next statement until the end conditions are satisfied.
Defines the order of the arguments, the type, and number for the main program that uses arguments in a sub program.
Control right is acquired by specifying the mechanism number of the robot to be controlled.
Calls up the subroutine at the designated label line.
This instruction makes a program branch to the specified label line unconditionally.
Starts/Stops the watch condition of the GPS function.
Starts/Stops the watch condition of the GPS function.
Interrupts the execution of the program and movement of the robot, and stops.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: HOpen <Hand No.>, <Starting grasp force>, <Holding grasp force>, <Starting grasp force holding time>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Commands the hand to open.
Commands the hand to close.
A process is selected and executed according to the results of an expression.
A process is selected and executed according to the results of an expression.
A process is selected and executed according to the results of an expression.
A process is selected and executed according to the results of an expression.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Input #<File No.>, <Input data name>, <Input data name>...
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Inputs data into a file (including communication lines).
Designates the override that is valid only during the robot's joint movements.
This instruction rewrites the current coordinate values by adding/subtracting the value specified by a parameter to/from the current joint coordinate values of the specified axis.
This instruction specifies the condition of the hand/workpiece at execution of the OADL instruction.
Using joint interpolation operation, moves from the current position to the destination position.
The movement type from current location to the movement purpose position is specified.
<Constants1>:0/1 = shortcut/detour
<Constants2>:0/1/2 = equivalent rotation/3-axis XYZ/singular point passage
This instruction moves the robot from the current position to the target position with an arch movement (arch interpolation).

TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: Mvc P1, P2, P3 Wth M_Out(17)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3D circular interpolation in the order of start point, transit point 1, transit point 2 and start point.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Mvr <Start Point>, <Transit Point>, <End Point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: Mvr P1, P2, P3 Type 0, 1 Wth M_Out(17)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement from the start point to the end point via transit points.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Mvr2 <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Reference point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: Mvr2 P1, P2, P3 Type 0, 1 Wth M_Out(17)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation motion from the start point to the end point on the arc composed of the start point, end point, and reference points.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Mvr3 <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Center Point> Type <Constants 1>AC<Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: Mvr3 P1, P2, P3 Type 0, 1 Wth M_Out(17)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement from the start point to the end point on the arc composed of the center point, start point and end point.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Mvs <Movement Target Position>, <Close Distance> Type <Constants1>, <Constants2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out linear interpolation movement from the current position to the movement target position.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvs <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Movement Target Position> Type <Constants1>, <Constants2>
EMvs <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Movement Target Position> Type <Constants1>, <Constants2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out linear interpolation movement along Ex-T from the current position to the movement target position.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvc <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start point>, <Transit point 1>, <Transit point 2>
EMvc <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start point>, <Transit point 1>, <Transit point 2> <Additional condition>]
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: EMvc 2, P1, P2, P3 Wth M_Out(17)=1
EMvc 4, P3, (Plt 1,5), P4 WthIf M_In(20)=1, M_Out(21)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement along Ex-T in the order of start point, transit point 1, transit point 2 and start point.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvr <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <Transit Point>, <End Point>
EMvr <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <Transit Point>, <End Point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2>
EMvr <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <Transit Point>, <End Point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: EMvr 2, P1, P2, P3 Wth M_Out(17)=1
EMvr 4, P3, (Plt 1,5), P4 WthIf M_In(20)=1, M_Out(21)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement along Ex-T from the start point to the end point via transit points.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvr2 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Reference point>
EMvr2 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Reference point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2>
EMvr2 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Reference point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: EMvr2 2, P1, P2, P3 Wth M_Out(17)=1
EMvr2 4, P3, (Plt 1,5), P4 WthIf M_In(20)=1, M_Out(21)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement along Ex-T from the start point to the end point on the arc composed of the start point, end point, and reference points.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvr3 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Center Point>
EMvr3 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Center Point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2>]
EMvr3 <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Start Point>, <End Point>, <Center Point> Type <Constants 1>, <Constants 2> <Appended Condition>
TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: EMvr3 2, P1, P2, P3 Wth M_Out(17)=1
EMvr3 4, P3, (Plt 1,5), P4 WthIf M_In(20)=1, M_Out(21)=1
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Carries out 3-dimensional circular interpolation movement along Ex-T from the start point to the end point on the arc composed of the center point, start point and end point.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: MvSpl <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>
MvSpl <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>
MvSpl <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>, <Posture Interpolation Type>
MvSpl <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>, <Posture Interpolation Type>, <Filter Length>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The spline interpolation is executed based on information registered in the spline file specified by the spline number.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: EMvSpl <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>
EMvSpl <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>
EMvSpl <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>, <Posture Interpolation Type>
EMvSpl <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <Spline Number>, <Designated Speed>, <Acceleration and Deceleration Distance>, <Frame Conversion>, <Posture Interpolation Type>, <Filter Length>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The spline interpolation based on information registered in the spline file specified by the spline number executes along the Ex-T coordinate.
The robot's performance improves when the movement mode of the robot is selected.
1:Standard mode
2:High-speed positioning mode
3:Trajectory priority mode
4:Vibration suppression mode
The absolute position data is retrieved from an external source at each controller control time,and the robot is directly moved.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: NVClose #<Vision sensor number>, [#<Vision sensor number>[,#<Vision sensor number>]]
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Cuts the line with the specified vision sensor.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: NVIn #<Vision sensor number>, [<Vision program name>], <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>, [<Timeout>]
NVIn #<Vision sensor number>, "", <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>, [<Timeout>]
NVIn #<Vision sensor number>, [<Vision program name>], <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>
NVIn #<Vision sensor number>, "", <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Receives the results of the recognition by the vision sensor.
The data received from the vision sensor is stored in the robot controller robot status variables.
Loads the specified vision program into the vision sensor.
Connects with the specified vision sensor and logs on to that vision sensor.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: NVPst #<Vision sensor number>, <Vision program name>, <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>, [<Timeout>]
NVPst #<Vision sensor number>, <Vision program name>, <Recognition count cell>, <Start cell>, <End cell>, <Type>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Starts the specified vision program and obtains the results.
The data received from the vision sensor is stored in the robot controller robot status variables.
Starts the specified vision program.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>, <encoder 4>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>, <encoder 4>, <encoder 5>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>, <encoder 4>, <encoder 5>, <encoder 6>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>, <encoder 4>, <encoder 5>, <encoder 6>, <encoder 7>
NVTrg #<Vision sensor number>, <Delay time>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <encoder 2>, <encoder 3>, <encoder 4>, <encoder 5>, <encoder 6>, <encoder 7>, <encoder 8>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Requests the specified vision program to capture an image and the value of an external encoder is read.
Automatically sets the optimum acceleration/deceleration according to the robot hand's load state (Optimum acceleration/deceleration control).
Automatically sets the optimum acceleration/deceleration according to the robot hand's load state (Optimum acceleration/deceleration control).
Disable the function.
Enable the function.
Defines the starting line of a branching subroutine when an interrupt is generated from a designated communication line.
Calls up the subroutine at the label corresponding to the value.
Branches to the line with the label that corresponds to the designated value.
Open the file or communication lines.
This instruction specifies the speed of the robot movement as a value in the range from 1 to 100%.
Calculates the position of grid in the pallet.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: PIChng <Palette No>, <Stacking Info No>, <Work Size L>, <Work Size W>, <Work Size H>
PIChng <Palette No>, <Stacking Info No>, <Work Size L>, <Work Size W>, <Work Size H>, <Palette Size L>, <Palette Size W>, <Palette Size H>
PIChng <Palette No>, <Stacking Info No>, <Work Size L>, <Work Size W>, <Work Size H>, <Palette Size L>, <Palette Size W>, <Palette Size H>, <Space L>, <Space W>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Expand the stacking information to a variable.
This instruction is used to improve the motion path tracking.
This instruction is used to improve the motion path tracking.
Outputs data into a file (including communication lines).
This instruction specifies the priority (number of lines executed in priority) when programs are executed in multitask operation.
It is used to release the mechanism obtained by the GetM instruction.
Uses the following character strings as comments.
This instruction resets an error generated in the robot controller.
When returning from a normal subroutine returns to the next line after the GoSub.
When returning from an interrupt processing subroutine, returns either to the line where the interrupt was generated, or to the next line.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: SplWrt <Spline Number>, <File Name>, <Operation Mode>, <Spline Cancel Angle>
SplWrt <Spline Number>, <File Name>, <Operation Mode>, <Spline Cancel Angle>, <Block Length Ratio>
SplWrt <Spline Number>, <File Name>, <Operation Mode>, <Spline Cancel Angle>, <Block Length Ratio>, <Ex-T Coordinate Number>
SplWrt <Spline Number>, <File Name>, <Operation Mode>, <Spline Cancel Angle>, <Block Length Ratio>, <Ex-T Coordinate Number>, <File Version>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: A spline file is created based on the path point information which was registered with the specified file.

Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.
Executes one of multiple statement blocks according to the condition expression value.

Controls the On and Off of the servo motor power.

TEMPLATE.SAMPLE: SetCalFrm P1, P2, P3, P4, P5, P6
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The reference and correction coordinate used by the frame conversion are set.
Specify the Effective or invalidity of Mo-Trigger.
Transfers control of the program to the next line.
Designates the speed for the robot's linear and circular movements.
Designates the speed for the robot's linear and circular movements.
Designates the speed for the robot's linear and circular movements.
Appends the title to the program.
Designates the tool conversion data.
Designates the torque limit for each axis.
Specify the workpiece coordinate system origin and the logic number of an external encoder used in tracking operation.
Clears the tracking data buffer.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Trk On, <Measurement position data>, <Encoder data>, <Reference position data>
Trk On, <Measurement position data>, <Encoder data>, <Reference position data>, <Encoder number>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The robot works while following to the movement of the conveyor.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: Trk On, <Measurement position data>, <Encoder data>, <Reference position data>
Trk On, <Measurement position data>, <Encoder data>, <Reference position data>, <Encoder number>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: The robot works while following to the movement of the conveyor.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: TrkArc <Condition number>, <Encoder number>, <Circular arc position 1>, <Circular arc position 2>, <Circular arc position 3>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Conveyor information for a circular arc tracking is set.
This command checks the workpiece state of specified <Condition number>.
This command collectively executes the interrupt processing, the tracking starting, and move to the tracking upper position.
This command collectively executes the interrupt processing, the tracking starting, and move to the tracking upper position.
This command is waited for until the workpiece enters the range.
The accuracy of the tracking function improves
The accuracy of the tracking function improves

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>, <enc. 4>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>, <enc. 4>, <enc. 5>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>, <enc. 4>, <enc. 5>, <enc. 6>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>, <enc. 4>, <enc. 5>, <enc. 6>, <enc. 7>
TrkTrg #<Vision number>, <SKIP input number>, <encoder 1 value read-out variable>, <enc. 2>, <enc. 3>, <enc. 4>, <enc. 5>, <enc. 6>, <enc. 7>, <enc. 8>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Requests the specified vision program to capture an image and the value of an external encoder is read.
The specified general-purpose output signal is turned on and the value of an external encoder is read.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: TrRd <Position data>, <Encoder data>, <Model number>, <Buffer number>, <Encoder number>
TrRd <Position data>, <Encoder data>, <Model number>, <Buffer number>, <Encoder number>, <Pixel position>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Read position data for tracking operation, encoder data and so on from the data buffer.
After that, the value is written in the specified variable.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: TrWrt <Position data>, <Encoder data>, <Model number>, <Buffer number>, <Encoder number>
TrWrt <Position data>, <Encoder data>, <Model number>, <Buffer number>, <Encoder number>, <Pixel position>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Write position data for tracking operation, encoder data and so on in the data buffer.
Demand the execution of the calibration measurement.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: V3Calib #<Vision sensor number>, <PostureID>, <Storage Number>, <Mechanical I/F coordinates>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Transmit information for the calibration.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: V3Close #<Vision sensor number>, #<Vision sensor number>[,#<Vision sensor number>]
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Cuts the line with the specified MELFA-3D vision.
Connects with the specified MELFA-3D Vision sensor.

TEMPLATE.FORMAT: V3Run #<Vision sensor number>, <Job Name>, <Work Area ID>, <Measurement flag>, <Recognition flag>
V3Run #<Vision sensor number>, <Job Name>, <Work Area ID>, <Measurement flag>, <Recognition flag>, <Target number>
V3Run #<Vision sensor number>, <Job Name>, <Work Area ID>, <Measurement flag>, <Recognition flag>, <Target number>, <Storage Number>
V3Run #<Vision sensor number>, <Job Name>, <Work Area ID>, <Measurement flag>, <Recognition flag>, <Target number>, <Storage Number>, <Mechanical I/F coordinates>
TEMPLATE.COMMENT: Demand the execution of the job that specifies it for MELFA-3D Vision.
Waits for the variable to reach the designated value.
The program between the While statement and WEnd statement is repeated until the loop conditions are satisfied.
The program between the While statement and WEnd statement is repeated until the loop conditions are satisfied.
A process is added to the interpolation motion.
A process is conditionally added to the interpolation motion command.
This instruction cancels the program selection status of the specified task slot from within a program.
This instruction commands the specified program to be loaded into the specified task slot from within a program.
This instruction returns the program control to the first line if the program of the specified task slot is paused by a command within the program (program reset).
This instruction executes concurrently the specified programs from within a program.
This instruction pauses the execution of the program in the specified task slot from within a program.
